revised_title: On the Influence of Voltaic Currents on the Diffusion of Liquids
tldr: The author discusses the effects of electric currents on the diffusion of liquids and the separation of boundary layers of two liquids. They observed that the boundary surfaces of contact become indefinite when the current passes from a lighter to a heavier solution and become sharply defined when the current leaves the heavier and re-enters the lighter liquid. The author also mentions that reversing the direction of the current several times can reverse these effects.
